intro: Steironema floridum, commonly known as Florida starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features small, star-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, blooming in the spring. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Steironema floridum is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
